question: What is the purpose of the IJCAI 2023 conference?
answer:
1. IJCAI2023: calls: Call for IJCAI 2023 Doctoral Consortium Program: Application and Submission Instructions: "As a premier and largest conference on AI, the mission of IJCAI is to provide a platform for researchers in AI to report their findings, exchange ideas, and contribute to the advancement of the field."

2. IJCAI2023: calls: Call For Demos: Topics: "As the premier general conference on AI, IJCAI 2023 welcomes submissions across all areas of AI; the Demonstrations Track of IJCAI 2023 follows this principle, though with an emphasis on the applicability of AI to practice."

question: What are the eligibility criteria for students wishing to participate in the IJCAI Student Volunteer Program?
answer:
1. IJCAI2023: grants: Call for Volunteers: Students are invited to participate in the IJCAI Student Volunteer Program. 
2. Any full-time university student, at any level, may apply to participate, whether or not they are presenting a paper. 
3. Priority will be given to those students who have accepted contributions to the IJCAI, including main conference, workshop, tutorial, competition, etc.

question: What is the primary focus of the "Multi-Year Track on AI and Social Good" special track at IJCAI 2023?
answer:
1. IJCAI2023: calls: Call For Papers And Projects: Multi-Year Track On AI And Social Good (Special Track): 
- "The Multi-Year Track on AI and Social Good (Special Track) aims to showcase innovative AI research that offers solutions to challenges faced by societies around the world. The track seeks to create a bridge between AI and social good, and to stimulate discussion on how AI can be used to tackle societal issues, such as Health and Well-being, Environmental Sustainability, Education, and AI Ethics and Governance."
2. IJCAI2023: calls: Call For Papers And Projects: Multi-Year Track On AI And Social Good (Special Track): Clarification on Large Language Model Policy LLM: 
- "papers to the AI for Social Good track at IJCAI 2023"
3. IJCAI2023: calls: Call For Papers And Projects: Multi-Year Track On AI And Social Good (Special Track): Submission of Demos: 
- "special track’s topic to the IJCAI 2023 Demo track, indicating the “AI and Social Good” nature of the demo"

question: How will The IJCAI 2023 handle submissions of research project proposals in the "Multi-Year Track on AI and Social Good" special track?
answer:
1. IJCAI2023: calls: Call For Papers And Projects: Multi-Year Track On AI And Social Good (Special Track): Submission of Research Project Proposals: Research project proposals are not envisioned to present research results in this edition of IJCAI. Still, selected proposals will be expected to report on their progress during the three subsequent editions of IJCAI (2024 – 2026) and submit a research paper to one of these conference editions. In addition, selected research project proposals from the AI and Social Good track will be presented to a panel of government officials, NGOs and private companies at IJCAI 2023 to receive feedback on the project implementation plan and follow-up actions.
2. IJCAI2023: calls: Call For Papers And Projects: Multi-Year Track On AI And Social Good (Special Track): We invite two types of contributions: research papers and research project proposals. The authors who wish to submit demos that are relevant to the theme of AI and Social Good are invited to submit them via the IJCAI 2023 Demo track.
3. IJCAI2023: calls: Call For Papers And Projects: Multi-Year Track On AI And Social Good (Special Track): Submission of Research Project Proposals: We suggest the following structure for research project proposals: problem statement, link to specific SDGs and LNOB principle, strategy, methods, case studies, expected results, evaluation criteria, challenges and limitations, ethical considerations, implementation plan and needs, project team description. The selection criteria will include expertise, feasibility, contribution to SDGs and LNOB principle, and contribution to state-of-the-art in AI, social or natural sciences. Research project proposals should follow the same format and general instructions as the main track submissions, with the exception of including a 1-page appendix with team member CVs and allowing technical appendices. No author rebuttal or summary reject phase will be included. Accepted research project proposals will be published in the IJCAI 2023 proceedings.

2. IJCAI2023: calls: Call For Papers: AI The Arts And Creativity (Special Track): Submission of Demos: Unlike in 2022, the authors will not be able to submit demos to the AI, Arts & Creativity track.
